prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Kay Faraday
Description: Young girl purporting to be the 2nd Yatagarasu. She's on the trail of her father's killer.
Character 1
Name: Byrne Faraday
Description: Father of Kay, and admirable prosecutor, he was killed 7 years ago by Calisto Yew
Character 2
Name: Calisto Yew
Description: Killed Kay's father 7 years ago. Claimed to be Yatagarasu and then made her escape.
Character 3
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 4
Name: Shih-na
Description: Lang's trusty secretary. Level-headed, she supports him in his investigations.
Character 5
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: Daughter of my mentor, Manfred von Karma. Cooperating w/ Interpol on smuggling case.
Character 6
Name: Colias Palaeno
Description: Ambassador of Babahl who will do absolutely everything for his country's tourism industry.
Character 7
Name: Manny Coachen
Description: The victim. Amb. Palaeno's secretary and secretariat. Apparently, was a good man.
Character 8
Name: Shi-Long Lang
Description: Boasts he has the highest arrest rate in Interpol. He is after the smuggling ring.
Character 9
Name: Quercus Alba
Description: Ambassador of Allebahst. Also retired army man. May explain why overly-harsh on himself.
Character 10
Name: Larry Butz
Description: The man under the Steel Samurai mask. Sadly, he is a friend from grade school.
Character 11
Name: Tyrell Badd
Description: Eagle-eyed homicide det. His partner was killed 7 yrs. ago. He's here after Calisto Yew.
Character 12
Name: Mask☆DeMasque II
Description: Opportunist unrelated to 1st DeMasque. Found in Allebahst. Real name: Ka-Shi Nou.
Character 13
Name: Ex-Security Lady
Description: The woman behind the Pink Princess mask. I believe her real name is Wendy Oldbag.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 1
Name: Embassy Guide
Description: Two countries share this building with borders.
Evidence 2
Name: Steel Samurai's Autograph
Description: Autograph with a sketch of his face and weapon.
Evidence 3
Name: Notes on Coachen's Body
Description: COD: single stab to base of neck. The body wasn't badly burnt by the fire.
Evidence 4
Name: Yatagarasu's Key
Description: The Yatagarasu stole this from this embassy 7 years ago. It is also a knife.
Evidence 5
Name: Knife
Description: Covered in victim's blood, the blade matches the wound. Butterfly motif is noteworthy. [caption] The blade is red with blood, while the handle with the butterfly motif is completely clean. 1 of a set of 3 ornamental knives. Covered in victim's blood, blade same as wound. The blade is definitely Allebahstian. Was this carried across country lines? Blade determined to be Allebahstian. The flower motif's petals are separate.
Evidence 6
Name: Babahl's Primidux Statue
Description: Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Only Amb. and Secret. can touch. It was a fake, but was swapped with the real one. Is originally from Allebahst.
Evidence 7
Name: Cohdopian Paper Document
Description: Accounting doc related to smuggling. Proof someone in 1 of the countries is ringleader. Doc related to smuggling of Babahlese ink. It appears to point to Mr. Coachen.
Edgeworth:
Take a good look at these documents, Franziska.
Franziska:
It says that there are three pages in total, and yet, there are only two here.
Edgeworth:
Correct. Now take a look at the smuggling activity document in your possession. Tell me, is it not possible that your page was taken from this set of three?
Franziska:
Well, well... It certainly looks that way.
Edgeworth:
By putting our multi-part puzzle together, we seem to have arrived at an answer. And it seems that you have now found what you were looking for.
Franziska:
Yes, and with this, it has become crystal clear... ...that Mr. Coachen himself was responsible for the mass smuggling of Babahlese ink!
Evidence 8
Name: Babahlese Knife Handle
Description: Swapped with the real murder weapon's handle, its blade has yet to be found.
Evidence 9
Name: Counterfeit Bills
Description: Made with Babahlese ink, they are in circulation in Zheng Fa. It's hard to tell they're fake. Bills circulating in Zheng Fa. Made by Coachen. They were all burned up in Babahl.
Evidence 10
Name: Babahlese Ink
Description: Special whitcrystal oil-based ink. Limited export because of some specific reason. Special whitcrystal oil-based ink. Limited export because of its use in counterfeiting.
Evidence 11
Name: DeMasque II's Note
Description: Request for the theft of the Primidux Statue with a map to where the statue is. Request to steal the Primidux Statue. Same shape as notepad in Babahl office. Request to steal the Primidux Statue. Handwriting matches that of Manny Coachen.
Evidence 12
Name: Samurai Sword
Description: Weapon that's used on stage. Is thought to be what killed DeMasque II.
Evidence 13
Name: Photo with Steel Samurai
Description: Taken in front of Allebahst's Statue before murder.
Evidence 14
Name: Passionflowers
Description: Two large flowers in bloom. The vines are supported by stakes and are still growing. Two large flowers in bloom. Ambassador Alba takes great care in growing them.
Evidence 15
Name: Samurai Spear
Description: Weapon that's used on stage. Larry hit it against a wall and bent it. It's hollow. Because he bent it, Larry couldn't do the "Early Summer Rain Jab!" special attack.
Evidence 16
Name: Allebahst's Primidux Statue
Description: Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Only Amb. and Secret. can touch. Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Signs it was moved during murder. Bloodstained weapon used to kill DeMasque. Originally from Babahl's secretariat's office. Used to be real, but has been swapped with a fake from Babahl. Was used as a weapon.
Evidence 17
Name: Stand-In Request
Description: Request for Ms. Oldbag to stand in for Mindy, the Pink Princess actress who fell ill.
Evidence 18
Name: Letter from a Stalker
Description: For Ms. Oldbag. Has mistakes from bad penmanship.
Evidence 19
Name: Lady's Undershirt
Description: Found in office fireplace. There's only 1 person here who would own such a shirt. Found in office fireplace. Ms. Oldbag was drying it in the fireplace next door.
Evidence 20
Name: Samurai Dogs
Description: Present for embassy staff. Ms. Oldbag took and ate a few from the dressing room.
Evidence 21
Name: Silhouette Lantern
Description: Runs on whitcrystal oil, which burns green. It's a Babahlese souvenir.
Evidence 22
Name: Pick
Description: Found at the Open-Air Stage, it looks like a guitar pick. It's also wet for some reason.
Evidence 23
Name: Ms. Yew's Perfume
Description: This was left behind by Calisto Yew 7 years ago. Kay has been safe-guarding it.
Evidence 24
Name: Fountain Spouts
Description: Part of the Rose Garden pool. Auto-refills the water when the water level is too low.
Evidence 25
Name: Photo of Yatagarasu
Description: Taken from a building nearby at the moment of border crossing during the fire. Photo taken after the first fire on the 4th and 5th floors had taken place.
Evidence 26
Name: Fires in Babahl
Description: Two fires broke out in Babahl today.
Evidence 27
Name: Amb. Palaeno's Testimony
Description: Spilled Babahlese ink onto back wall while burning files in fireplace. Left ashes there.
Evidence 28
Name: Wire
Description: A good length of wire that was found wound up inside Babahl's grandfather clock.
Evidence 29
Name: Revolving Fireplace Wall
Description: There are signs that the revolving fireplace wall on Babahl's side has been used.
Evidence 30
Name: Hair Sticks → Crossbow Arrows
Description: Hair sticks with a candy stripe pattern on them. There is some dirt on the tips. Thought to be hair sticks, they're passionflower support stakes from Allebahst office. Neither hair sticks nor support stakes, they're actually crossbow arrows.
Evidence 31
Name: Trump Card
Description: Evidence from KG-8. Card containing orders from boss of smuggling ring to Coachen.
Evidence 32
Name: Video Tape
Description: Evidence from KG-8. Faraday had obtained it once, but Ernest Amano had it stolen. Evidence from KG-8. Footage showing Coachen entering the KG-8 Incident's crime scene.
Evidence 33
Name: Counterfeit Plate
Description: This was found from within the fake Primidux Statue Alba smuggled into his country.
Evidence 34
Name: Amb. Alba's Wound
Description: Mr. Alba claims it's proof he was stabbed by DeMasque II, so it was justified defence.
Evidence 35
Name: Commemorative Photo
Description: Taken at Theatrum Neutralis. The murder weapon can be seen in Mr. Alba's bouquet.
Evidence 36
Name: Security Footage
Description: Footage of the entranceways into Babahl and Allebahst from the Theatrum Neutralis.
Evidence 37
Name: Pushcart
Description: Steel Samural pushed this to Allebahst from the dressing room. The bulge is unnatural. Steel Samurai pushed this to Allebahst from the dressing room. There is blood inside.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Even your police confirmed that the Yatagarasu infiltrated the Babahlese embassy tonight.
Person: Shih-na
Testimony 1
Testimony: Utilizing the confusion caused by the fire, the Yatagarasu snuck into this embassy.
Person: Shih-na
Testimony 2
Testimony: Furthermore, this girl claims to be the Yatagarasu.
Person: Shih-na
Testimony 3
Testimony: She wanted to steal documents regarding smuggling, so she killed Mr. Coachen for the key.
Person: Shih-na
Testimony 4
Testimony: And most importantly, other than her, there was no one else in here with the body.
Person: Shih-na

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this scenario. Let's start by going through the evidence and testimonies provided.

First, the characters involved include Kay Faraday, who is a young girl claiming to be the Yatagarasu, and Calisto Yew, who was her father's killer seven years ago. The main focus seems to be on a smuggling case involving Babahlese ink, and there's a lot of evidence related to that, like the Yatagarasu's Key, the Knife, and various documents that point towards Manny Coachen being involved.

Looking at the testimonies, Shih-na, Lang's secretary, testifies that Kay Faraday claimed to be the Yatagarasu and wanted to steal documents regarding smuggling. She also mentioned that no one else was present when Mr. Coachen was killed, which suggests that Kay acted alone.

Now, examining the evidence, the Yatagarasu's Key was used to kill Mr. Coachen, and the Knife, which has a butterfly motif, was found covered in blood. The testimony suggests that Kay was the one who committed the murder. However, there's also evidence that the Knife was part of a set, with only two found, which might imply that another knife is missing.

But wait, there's also a mention of a third knife in the evidence list, specifically the Babahlese Knife Handle, which was swapped with the real murder weapon's handle. This suggests that the Knife found at the scene might not be the actual murder weapon, but rather a swapped handle. This could mean that the real murder weapon is still missing or that the evidence was tampered with.

Considering the testimonies, Shih-na states that Kay was the one who killed Mr. Coachen and acted alone. However, the evidence shows that the Knife found at the scene might not be the actual murder weapon, indicating a potential discrepancy. This contradiction arises because the testimony directly implicates Kay as the murderer, but the evidence suggests that the actual murder weapon might be different or missing, which could mean that someone else was involved or that the evidence was planted.

Another point to consider is the Yatagarasu's Key. The testimony suggests that Kay used this key to steal documents, but the evidence shows that the key was used in the murder, which might indicate that the key was both a tool for theft and a weapon. This could add complexity to the timeline, but it's more about the method of the crime rather than a direct contradiction.

The most significant contradiction seems to be between the testimony that Kay acted alone and the evidence suggesting that the Knife found might not be the actual murder weapon. This implies that either the evidence was planted or that there's another suspect involved who hasn't been identified yet.

In conclusion, the evidence and testimony contradict each other because the testimony directly links Kay Faraday to the murder, while the evidence indicates that the Knife found might not be the actual murder weapon, suggesting either tampering or another suspect.
</think>

cot:
Alright, let's dive into this problem. I'm presented with a complex scenario involving multiple characters, evidences, and testimonies from various sources. My task is to identify a pair where evidence contradicts testimony. The characters involved include law enforcement officials, a young girl on a quest for justice, and a variety of suspects and witnesses. The evidences provided span from physical items like weapons and documents to testimonies from key figures in the case.

First, I need to understand the relationships between the characters and the context of the case. The main suspect is Calisto Yew, who killed Kay Faraday's father, Byrne Faraday, seven years ago. Yew is also known as the Yatagarasu, a notorious thief. The current investigation involves figuring out who is responsible for the recent murder of Manny Coachen, the secretary of Ambassador Colias Palaeno, and the subsequent theft of the Babahlese Primidux statue.

Looking at the evidences, there's a mention of a knife with a butterfly motif found at the crime scene, which matches the wound on Manny Coachen's body. This knife is part of a special three-piece set, and its handle was swapped with the real murder weapon's handle, while the blade is still missing. Additionally, there's evidence of Babahlese ink being used in counterfeit bills, which points to Coachen as the ringleader of the smuggling operation.

Now, examining the testimonies, particularly from Shih-na, who supports the claim that Kay Faraday is the Yatagarasu and is responsible for the murder. Shih-na states that the knife wound on Coachen is consistent with the butterfly knife, implying that Kay used it as the murder weapon. She also mentions that the knife is part of a special set, reinforcing the idea that it's the murder weapon.

However, there's a contradiction here. The evidence indicates that the knife's handle was swapped with the real murder weapon's handle, suggesting that the actual murder weapon was used to kill Coachen, not the butterfly knife. This implies that the butterfly knife is a decoy, and the real weapon, which is still missing, is the actual murder weapon. Therefore, the testimony that the butterfly knife is the murder weapon contradicts the evidence that the handle was swapped, indicating that the real weapon is the one responsible for the murder.

In summary, the evidence shows that the butterfly knife's handle was swapped, implying it's not the actual murder weapon, while the testimony claims it is. This discrepancy is the contradiction we're looking for.
</think>

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, let's tackle this problem step by step. I'm given a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies from a fictional scenario involving a murder mystery. The goal is to identify which piece of evidence contradicts which testimony. 

First, I'll need to carefully review all the evidence and testimonies provided. The characters involved include Kay Faraday, her father Byrne Faraday, the suspect Calisto Yew, and various other characters like Dick Gumshoe, Shih-na, Franziska von Karma, and Ambassadors from different countries. 

Looking at the testimonies, I see that Shih-na, a secretary, testifies that the knife wound on the body is consistent with the blade of the knife, and that the knife with the butterfly handle is the murder weapon which the killer was holding. She also mentions that she assumes Kay obtained the knife from a display rack and used it on the victim, and that the knife is part of a special 3-piece set with a unique design.

Now, examining the evidence, I find that Evidence 5 describes the knife as having a butterfly motif, matching the testimony. However, there's a detail in the testimony that the handle is clean, while the blade is bloodstained. This seems contradictory because if the knife was used in a murder, one would expect both the handle and the blade to be bloodstained. 

Furthermore, the testimony mentions that the knife is part of a special 3-piece set, but the evidence doesn't explicitly mention the existence of such a set. This could imply that the testimony is stretching the evidence or adding details not explicitly stated.

Based on this analysis, the testimony that the knife's handle is completely clean while the blade is bloodstained directly contradicts the evidence, as both should be bloodstained if used in a murder. Additionally, the mention of the knife being part of a special set without explicit evidence supports the idea that the testimony is adding details not supported by the given evidence.
</think>
